content.webTitle: Degussa warns of further job losses and closures

fields.headline: Degussa warns of further job losses and closures
fields.bodyText: Degussa, Germany's third-largest chemicals company, said yesterday that it could not rule out job losses and plant closures after announcing it was taking a £565m impairment charge at its fine chemicals business. Degussa said the bulk of the charge related to Laporte in Britain, which it bought in 2001. Degussa had already begun restructuring its fine chemicals business with the loss of up to 700 jobs by 2007 and warned that further cuts could follow. Several fine chemicals makers have reported downturns recently, in part due to increasing competition from rivals in Asia.
